Every JSF XHTML page or template you create (or copy from the examples)
should always, without exception, include the /common.xhtml header,
which shows:

  • When the page was served.
  • The running Mojarra (JSF implementation) version.
  • The running PrimeFaces build version.
  • The running Java version.
  • A link back to this home (index) page, which has links to the actual test pages.
You may wish to edit the IDE and Server info in the header, please see /common.xhtml.

BTW it also includes a CSS style file /resources/css/styles.css, which you may edit.
